context: Microscopic suspension direct laryngoscopy with biopsy of left true vocal cord stripping.

text: biopsy of left true vocal cord stripping
context: Microscopic suspension direct laryngoscopy with biopsy of left true vocal cord stripping
Hoarseness, bilateral true vocal cord lesions, and leukoplakia

Hoarseness, bilateral true vocal cord lesions, and leukoplakia
The patient is a 33-year-old Caucasian male with a history of chronic hoarseness and bilateral true vocal cord lesions, and leukoplakia discovered on a fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy in the office
The patient is a 33-year-old Caucasian male with a history of chronic hoarseness and bilateral true vocal cord lesions, and leukoplakia discovered on a fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy in the office
After this, the patient was placed under general endotracheal intubation anesthesia and the operative table was turned 90 degrees by the Department of Anesthesia.

After this, a mouthguard was placed in the upper teeth and a Dedo laryngoscope was placed in the patient's oral cavity and advanced through the oral cavity in the oropharynx down into the hypopharynx.

text: true vocal cords hidden underneath what appeared to be redundant false vocal cords
context: The patient's larynx was then brought into view with the true vocal cords hidden underneath what appeared to be redundant false vocal cords.
The left true vocal cord was then first addressed and appeared to have an extensive area of leukoplakia extending from the posterior one-third up to the anterior third

text: false vocal cord also appeared to be very full on the left side along with fullness in the subglottic region
context: The false vocal cord also appeared to be very full on the left side along with fullness in the subglottic region. The patient's anterior commissure appeared to be clear.

text: anterior commissure appeared to be clear
context: The patient's anterior commissure appeared to be clear.

text: false cord on the right side also appeared to be very redundant and overshadowing the true vocal cord
context: The patient's anterior commissure appeared to be clear. The false cord on the right side also appeared to be very redundant and overshadowing the true vocal cord.

text: second area of leukoplakia involving the right true vocal cord
context: Once the true vocal cord was retracted laterally, there was revealed a second area of leukoplakia involving the right true vocal cord in the anterior one-third aspect.

text: subglottic region was very edematous and with redundant mucosal tissue
context: The patient's subglottic region was very edematous and with redundant mucosal tissue.

text: leukoplakia appeared to be cobblestoned in appearance, irregularly bordered, and very hard to the touch.
context: The areas of leukoplakia appeared to be cobblestoned in appearance, irregularly bordered, and very hard to the touch.
The left true vocal cord was then first addressed, was stripped from posteriorly to anteriorly utilizing a #45 laryngeal forceps.

text: tropical adrenaline and a rectal swab to
context: After this, the patient had pressure placed upon this area with tropical adrenaline and a rectal swab to maintain hemostasis.
The specimen was passed off the field and was sent to Pathology for evaluation.

text: biopsies were taken under direct visualization
context: The biopsies were taken under direct visualization utilizing the Zeiss operating microscope

text: base of the tongue were all directly visualized
context: After the specimen was taken and the laryngoscope was desuspended from the Mayo stand and Louie arm was removed, the scope was then pulled more cephalad and the piriform sinuses, valecula, and base of the tongue were all directly visualized, which appeared normal except for the left base of tongue appeared to be full.

text: left base of tongue appeared to be full
context: After the specimen was taken and the laryngoscope was desuspended from the Mayo stand and Louie arm was removed, the scope was then pulled more cephalad and the piriform sinuses, valecula, and base of the tongue were all directly visualized, which appeared normal except for the left base of tongue appeared to be full.

text: This area was biopsied multiple times
context: This area was biopsied multiple times with a straight laryngeal forceps and passed off the field and sent to Pathology as specimen.

text: oral cavity demonstrated no signs of any gross lesions.
context: The scope was then pulled back into the superior aspect of hypopharynx into the oropharynx and the oral cavity demonstrated no signs of any gross lesions
A bimanual examination was then performed, which again demonstrated a fullness on the left base of tongue region with no signs of any other gross lesions.

text: fullness on the left base of tongue region
context: A bimanual examination was then performed, which again demonstrated a fullness on the left base of tongue region with no signs of any other gross lesions.

text: no signs of any palpable cervical lymphadenopathy.
context: There were no signs of any palpable cervical lymphadenopathy
The patient did receive intraoperatively 10 mg of Decadron.
The patient will be sent home with prescriptions for Medrol DOSEPAK, Tylenol with Codeine, Elixir, and amoxicillin 250 mg per 5 cc.
